channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A year after the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO, Luigi Mangione fights to suppress key evidence
item.description: Officers played footage of them catching Mangione, trying to play it cool by chatting about his steak sandwich.

item.title: A Catfight in a Snake Pit in Philly’s Art Museum
item.description: While crazies quarrel in the City of Brotherly Love, Boston’s MFA does a superb Winslow Homer show . . . What does it all have to do with Canadians?

item.title: Teachers Offended At Losing ‘Professional’ Title Should Look At Their Pointless Credentialing
item.description: Much of the outrage stems from insecurity about the actual skills that supposedly qualify these jobs as 'professions' in the first place.

item.title: U.S. Special Operations commander to brief congressional leadership
item.description: The commander of the U.S. Special Operations Command is set to meet with congressional oversight committee leadership on Thursday as pressure builds o...

item.title: The Budget Crunch Is Coming. States Must Adjust Their Spending Accordingly
item.description: The trend toward budget shortfalls is unmistakable.

item.title: House GOP launches blitz of bills to shut down CCP infiltration of US schools: 'Commonsense'
item.description: House Republicans advance bills targeting Chinese Communist Party influence in U.S. schools. Legislation aims to protect students from CCP propaganda.

item.title: The Lie Of Third-World Assimilation Is Finally Dead
item.description: The Afghan ambush and the Somali fraud scandal reveal a truth elites don't want to admit: the myth of assimilation has collapsed.

item.title: ‘I don’t know how people are going to live’: ACA enrollees brace for massive premium hikes as subsidies expire
item.description: “I don’t know how people are going to live, with it already being a struggle just to pay for food and all the other things,” Patricia Roberts, 52, sai...

item.title: More Skilled Construction Workers Are The Key To Solving America’s Housing Crisis
item.description: Rather than rent control and subsidies, there’s a real solution: addressing the critical shortage of skilled workers in construction.

item.title: WATCH: Dem lawmaker thanks Trump for pardon, says it came as a surprise amid re-election bid
item.description: President Donald Trump pardoned Rep. Henry Cuellar, who was charged with accepting $600,000 in bribes from the Azerbaijan government.

item.title: Steve Cropper, legendary guitarist on Memphis classics from ‘Green Onions’ to ‘In the Midnight Hour,’ dies at 84
item.description: Comedy fans know him as a key part of the Blues Brothers band, but almost everyone knows his understated style from dozens of soul classics.

item.title: Did a military lawyer witness the Venezuela 'double tap' boat strike? Experts say one should have
item.description: Legal experts call Pentagon's 'double tap' strike on shipwrecked survivors a textbook war crime, questioning military lawyer's role in operation.

item.title: What Survivor Can Teach Us About the Government
item.description: America’s politics now run like a reality show — and the villains keep winning.

item.title: A Farewell to the Separation of Powers?
item.description: With Trump v. Slaughter , presidential power may grow larger than ever before.

item.title: Meet Luana Lopes Lara: The 29-year-old ballerina spent summers working for Ray Dalio—now she’s the youngest female self-made billionaire
item.description: Following in the footsteps of Taylor Swift and Scale AI's Lucy Guo, Luana Lopes Lara has just been crowned the world's youngest female self-made billi...

item.title: Australia wants to end the era of kids on social media with international ban hailed as ‘first domino’ in global movement
item.description: If Meta, Google, and others can't figure out how to block accounts of users under 16 years old, they'll be fined $33 million per breach.

item.title: PA school faces fury after Muslim club’s pro-Palestinian display leaves Jewish students ‘shaken’
item.description: Pennsylvania school faces backlash from Jewish parents after Muslim student club distributed keffiyahs and pro-Palestinian messaging at culture fair.

item.title: Trump Admin To Stop Food Stamp Payments To Democrat States Covering Up Welfare Fraud
item.description: There appears to be a sense of cultural entitlement to these programs among its recipients, which needs to be confronted as well.

item.title: Democrats Would Like To Suppress Free Speech The Way Britain Does
item.description: The American left doesn’t look at the United Kingdom and see a cautionary tale, it sees a template to follow.
